text:
Julia Scarlett Elizabeth Louis-Dreyfus (born January 13, 1961 in New York City) is an American actress of partly Jewish descent.
Louis-Dreyfus is best known for her role as "Elaine Bennes" in the television series "Seinfeld". She is also noted for her work in other television programs and in movies. She also starred on the situation comedy "The New Adventures of Old Christine".
She won many awards, like the Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actress in a Comedy Series in 2017.
Family.
Ancestor and Jewish-French businessman Léopold Louis-Dreyfus founded the Louis Dreyfus Group in the nineteenth century.

annotations.surface_form: The New Adventures of Old Christine
